meanings.definition: To reduce the official value of a currency in relation to other currencies.
meanings.sent1: The government devaluated the currency to help exports.
meanings.sent2: The decision to devaluate the currency had a significant impact on international trade.
meanings.sent3: When the currency devaluated, it felt like a game of financial chess.
meanings.sent4: The devaluated currency was a sinking ship in the sea of global markets.
meanings.sent5: The act of devaluating the currency was like pulling the rug from under the economy.

meanings.definition: To decrease the worth or value of something.
meanings.sent1: The poor quality devaluated the product in the eyes of consumers.
meanings.sent2: Over time, neglect can devaluate even the most precious possessions.
meanings.sent3: The magician's spell accidentally devaluated the priceless artifact.
meanings.sent4: Her harsh words devaluated his self-esteem like a deflating balloon.
meanings.sent5: The constant criticism devaluated the once cherished painting to mere brushstrokes.
